page.title: 20LUNARDI
page.content: This year 1985 we are celebrating {Vincenzo Lunardi's Bicentenary. Lunardi was an{Italian Hydrogen {Balloonist who}landed his red and blue striped balloon in a field{south-east {of Ceres in 1785.}To celebrate his landing there will be a Hot Air Extravaganza on top of Tarvit Hill which shall include{Microlights, Gypsy {Moths, Helicopters and a parachute {display.Our}class P.6B at Castlehill School,Cupar studied Lunardi and our project won a certificate in a maths {competition.There is a street at the {end of St.Michaels Drive in Cupar {called "Lunardi's Place" which was {named after our visitor.}In October a plaque is being unveiled in the field were Lunardi landed his balloon.I hope the celebrations of Lunardi's landing are a success after all our efforts to bring him back.
